alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Leslie; McCreary; Perry; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harlan, Bell, Knox, southwestern Letcher, southern Leslie, southern Perry, southeastern McCreary and Whitley Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 415 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilton, or 8 miles west of Barbourville, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Baileys Switch, Swanpond, Garrich and Hubbs around 420 AM EDT. Barbourville, Hinkle, Yeager, Bimble, Cannon, Heidrick, Girdler, Baughman, Boone Heights and Green Road around 425 AM EDT. Barnyard, Scalf, Salt Gum, Hammond, Walker and Dewitt around 430 AM EDT. Erose, Mills, Field and Rella around 435 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Knox; Leslie; McCreary; Perry; Whitley
